text: Psalm 51
A Prayer of Repentance and Plea for Mercy
For the \add music\add* director. A psalm of David.

When Nathan the prophet came to him, after he had gone in to Bathsheba.\f + \fr Ps 51 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first two verses of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by two \f*
Be gracious to me, O God, according to your loyal love.
According to your abundant mercies,
blot out my transgressions.
Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity,
and from my sin cleanse me.
For ⸤I myself know⸥\f + \fr 51:3 \ft Literally “I, I know” \f* my transgressions,\f + \fr 51:3 \ft Or “rebellions” \f*
and my sin \add is\add* ever before me.
Against you, only you, I have sinned
and have done this evil\f + \fr 51:4 \ft Hebrew “the evil” \f* in your eyes,
so that you are correct when you speak,
you are blameless when you judge.
Behold, in iniquity I was born,
and in sin my mother conceived me.
Behold, you delight \add in\add* truth in the inward parts,
and in \add the\add* hidden \add parts\add* you make me to know wisdom.
Purify me with hyssop, and I shall be clean.
Wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
Make me hear joy and gladness;
let \add the\add* bones you have crushed rejoice.
Hide your face from my sins,
and all my iniquities blot out.
Create a clean heart for me, O God,
and renew a steadfast spirit ⸤within me⸥.\f + \fr 51:10 \ft Literally “in my inner parts” \f*
Do not cast me away from your presence,
and do not take your Holy Spirit from me.
Restore to me the joy of your salvation,
and with a willing spirit sustain me.
\add Then\add* I will teach transgressors your ways,
and sinners will turn back to you.
Deliver me from the guilt of bloodshed, O God,
the God of my salvation;
\add then\add* my tongue will sing aloud \add of\add* your righteousness.
O Lord, open my lips,
and my mouth will proclaim your praise.
For you do not delight \add in\add* sacrifice or I would give \add it\add*.
\add With\add* a burnt offering you are not pleased.
The sacrifices of God \add are\add* a broken spirit;
A broken and contrite heart,
O God, you will not despise.
Do good in your favor toward Zion.
Build the walls of Jerusalem.
Then you will delight \add in\add* righteous sacrifices,
burnt offering and whole burnt offering.
Then bulls will be offered on your altar.
